name: Appointment Request
description: The Appointment Request segment (ARQ) contains information about appointment requests for healthcare services. This segment is essential for scheduling workflows and appointment management, serving as the core component of SIU (Schedule Information Unsolicited) messages. The ARQ segment supports complex scheduling scenarios including recurring appointments, multi-resource booking, priority scheduling, and appointment modification requests. It provides the foundation for coordinating patient care, provider schedules, facility usage, and resource allocation in healthcare organizations.

cardinality.note: Required segment in SIU scheduling messages

ARQ.1.name: Placer Appointment ID
ARQ.1.description: This field contains the appointment identifier assigned by the placer application (the system requesting the appointment).
ARQ.1.generationHint: Unique appointment identifier from requesting system: APPT<date><sequence>^<system_id>

ARQ.2.name: Filler Appointment ID
ARQ.2.description: This field contains the appointment identifier assigned by the filler application (the system managing the appointments).
ARQ.2.generationHint: Unique appointment identifier from scheduling system: SCH<timestamp><counter>^<scheduler_id>

ARQ.3.name: Occurrence Number
ARQ.3.description: This field contains the occurrence number for recurring appointments, indicating which instance of a recurring series this appointment represents.
ARQ.3.generationHint: Sequential number for recurring appointments: 1, 2, 3, etc.

ARQ.4.name: Placer Group Number
ARQ.4.description: This field contains a group number assigned by the placer application for appointments that are part of a series or group.
ARQ.4.generationHint: Group identifier for related appointments: GRP<date><sequence>^<system_id>

ARQ.5.name: Schedule ID
ARQ.5.description: This field identifies the schedule or calendar into which this appointment should be placed.
ARQ.5.generationHint: Department or clinic schedule identifier for appointment placement

ARQ.6.name: Request Event Reason
ARQ.6.description: This field contains the reason for the appointment request or scheduling event.
ARQ.6.generationHint: Clinical reason driving the appointment request

ARQ.7.name: Appointment Reason
ARQ.7.description: This field contains the medical or administrative reason for the appointment.

validValues.description: Encounter for general adult medical examination
Encounter for screening mammogram for malignant neoplasm of breast

ARQ.7.generationHint: ICD-10 codes for medical reasons, or descriptive terms for administrative appointments

ARQ.8.name: Appointment Type
ARQ.8.description: This field specifies the type or category of appointment being requested.
ARQ.8.generationHint: OFFICE most common for regular visits, TELEMEDICINE increasingly used

ARQ.9.name: Appointment Duration
ARQ.9.description: This field specifies the expected duration of the appointment in minutes.
ARQ.9.generationHint: Duration in minutes: 15, 30, 45, 60 for common appointment types

ARQ.10.name: Appointment Duration Units
ARQ.10.description: This field specifies the units for the appointment duration.
ARQ.10.generationHint: MIN (minutes) most common for regular appointments

ARQ.11.name: Requested Start Date/Time Range
ARQ.11.description: This field contains the requested start date and time range for the appointment.
ARQ.11.generationHint: Date range for appointment scheduling flexibility: start_datetime^end_datetime

ARQ.12.name: Priority - ARQ
ARQ.12.description: This field indicates the priority level of the appointment request.
ARQ.12.generationHint: ROUTINE most common, STAT for emergencies, URGENT for expedited scheduling

ARQ.13.name: Repeating Interval
ARQ.13.description: This field specifies the interval for recurring appointments.
ARQ.13.generationHint: Recurring patterns: weekly, monthly, quarterly for follow-up appointments

ARQ.14.name: Repeating Interval Duration
ARQ.14.description: This field specifies how long the recurring appointment pattern should continue.
ARQ.14.generationHint: Duration for recurring series: 6 months, 1 year, indefinite

ARQ.15.name: Placer Contact Person
ARQ.15.description: This field identifies the person who can be contacted regarding this appointment request.
ARQ.15.generationHint: Referring provider, scheduler, or administrative contact for appointment coordination

ARQ.16.name: Placer Contact Phone Number
ARQ.16.description: This field contains the phone number for contacting the placer regarding this appointment.
ARQ.16.generationHint: Direct phone line for appointment coordination and changes

ARQ.17.name: Placer Contact Address
ARQ.17.description: This field contains the address for the placer contact person or organization.

ARQ.18.name: Placer Contact Location
ARQ.18.description: This field specifies the location of the placer contact person.
ARQ.18.generationHint: Physical location where placer contact can be reached

ARQ.19.name: Entered By Person
ARQ.19.description: This field identifies the person who entered the appointment request into the system.
ARQ.19.generationHint: User who created the appointment request - scheduler, nurse, or provider

ARQ.20.name: Entered By Phone Number
ARQ.20.description: This field contains the phone number of the person who entered the appointment request.
ARQ.20.generationHint: Contact number for the person who created the appointment request

ARQ.21.name: Entered By Location
ARQ.21.description: This field specifies the location where the appointment request was entered.
ARQ.21.generationHint: Department or workstation where appointment request was created

ARQ.22.name: Parent Placer Appointment ID
ARQ.22.description: This field contains the placer appointment ID of a parent appointment when this appointment is part of a series or related to another appointment.
ARQ.22.generationHint: Reference to parent appointment for linked or follow-up appointments

ARQ.23.name: Parent Filler Appointment ID
ARQ.23.description: This field contains the filler appointment ID of a parent appointment when this appointment is part of a series or related to another appointment.
ARQ.23.generationHint: Reference to parent appointment from scheduling system for linked appointments

ARQ.24.name: Placer Order Number
ARQ.24.description: This field contains a reference to an order that this appointment is intended to fulfill.
ARQ.24.generationHint: Link to procedure orders, lab orders, or imaging orders requiring appointments

ARQ.25.name: Filler Order Number
ARQ.25.description: This field contains the filler order number when the appointment is associated with a specific order.
ARQ.25.generationHint: Fulfilling system order identifier linked to the appointment

Priority scheduling helps manage urgent vs. routine appointment requests
Contact information enables effective appointment coordination and changes
